source.author: Duretto, M.F.; Hart, J.M.
source.title: Xanthosia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F.; Hart, J.M. (1999). Xanthosia. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves divided or deeply lobed; petiole 2–35 mm long
Leaves entire, cuneate, apex usually cleft into 3 notches; petiole to 5 mm long
Inflorescence (1–) 2-rayed; common peduncle 0–25 mm long; bracts and bracteoles c. linear, free; umbellules 1–3-flowered; flowers all bisexual

Inforescence 2–4-rayed, often the rays subtended by 1–3 sessile flowers; bracts and bracteoles ovate, bracteoles often partly or largely fused; umbellules 3–6-flowered; flowers male or bisexual; common peduncle 10–40 mm long
Leaves usually divided into 3 more or less equal leaflets
Leaves not divided into separate leaflets or if divided into leaflets terminal leaflet at least 1.5 times longer than lateral leaflets
Leaves villous or glabrescent, without stellate hairs; herbs or subshrubs
Leaflets linear-oblong to elliptic, usually villous, sometimes glabrescent; umbels 3–6-flowered, bracts 4–7 mm long; stems becoming flaky with age
Leaflets elliptic, glabrescent; umbels 1–3-flowered, bracts 3–4 mm long; stems not flaky
